name: El Dorado Hotel & Kitchen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Seems like deja vu reading the last review... My boyfriend and I booked this hotel based on the location and wanting a cool, updated place to stay. We chose a bungalow room after reading reviews that other rooms were too noisy. The hotel location is perfect... right on the square across from Girl and the Fig and next to Sunflower Caffe. It has all the right ideas for a boutique style hotel with an upbeat restaurant and a contemporary lounge area with a cool fireplace. It misses the mark everywhere else though. The registration desk is basically the hostess stand for the restaurant and it isn't very inviting. We arrived at prime dinner hour, so it was very noisy and we thought we were in the wrong spot for check-in. The guy showed us to our bungalow room which was out back behind the pool and parking lot. It was very cold out, so he took us through the restaurant, but carrying all our luggage while people were eating was quite awkward. The room has a private patio with a high fence that makes it feel like a dog pen. The front desk guy said, "this room has the biggest bathroom in the hotel!" Well the bathroom was huge, but the actual room was fairly small. We thought we were getting a king bed, but it was a queen. The bed itself was not very comfortable. The worst part was the A/C unit was very loud. We had to run the heat and the unit would shut on/off very frequently, waking us up each time. I've never had this problem before at a hotel. Main positives: it is VERY clean, has updated look (furniture and fixtures). We ate a light lunch in the cafe and the food and service were great! The room just wasn't worth the money and did not meet any of our expectations.
reviews.title: Quite disappointed but location can't be beat.

reviews.text: We were in a "bungalow room" behind the pool and separated from the main hotel. We had to walk through the bar area to an outdoor hallway, past the trash, past the always busy laundry room, through a gate, through the pool area, through another gate and into our room. I knew we were in trouble when the front desk guy who left his post to take us on this journey, said...This room has the best shower on the property! Actually looked like the room had once been designed as a handicapped room- the bathroom was almost as big as the room. We had reserved a king bed and got a queen that actually squeaked and sagged when sat upon. The lock on the door was defective and unable to be closed unless you used the key and brute strength. Complained immediately and was told they were fully booked, so we made the best of it. My son was in a room that faced onto the square and found it quite noisy. The location is great! We were able to walk out to dinner and to the mission and Vallejo's home. The manager seemed to be in hiding, but the young staff tried to be helpful and ended up apologizing a lot. The pool is very small and the chaises could use some new covers. There is limited parking in the back, and then you are on your own. I really didn't think it was worth $225 plus tax per night. We were given a 10% discount upon check out.
reviews.title: Depressing room...Great location

reviews.text: Did I mention location? Less than a hour from SFO, this hip hotel with a surperb restaurant downstairs is everything that you want for a stay in the town of Sonoma. I thought the room was tiny, but I wasnt there for the room. Front desk staff - remarkable. Many things to do right on the square or the adjacent side streets including many places for wine tasting, so you really do NOT have to drive after checking in. A real jewel in my opinion!
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: This hotel has a great location, close to restaurants,a CVS, a Whole Foods, church, etc. My room had a very comfortable bed and was clean, but was extremely dark and it was very difficult to dress or find something. The bathroom was also very clean with good light and excellent towels. It was bright and I had to go there all the time to look for things. We were a group attending a wedding and my nephew's room was also so dark, that at a point he put on a gray pant matching a black jacket. The bathroom window needs a shade since other guests can see you from their balconies and the closets are very tiny with very little hangers. I requested extra ones and I could only get two, when I really needed four. You can hear noise and conversations from other rooms. Service in the restaurant is very good and the girl at the front desk is very nice and helpful. If they improve these little things, it would be a perfect place to stay for a few days.
reviews.title: My recent stay at El Dorado Hotel in Sonoma, Ca

reviews.text: We booked with friends and we both booked king beds. We both got queens. The rate is the same as a room with kings. Our room near the top of the stairs was smaller. So small that we could not open the closet door. We were there early, so they certainly could have given us options. I would stay again, but I would be selective about the room.
reviews.title: Not all rooms are equal even if you pay the same.

reviews.text: The El Dorado was a pleasant surprise! Quaint and charming - in a great location.
reviews.title: So sad to leave!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was friendly and accommodating and the restaurant - amazing! If you are looking for a small boutique style hotel where you will feel so at home you never want to leave, this is it!
reviews.title: Quaint, clean boutique hotel in the Square
Great views of the square activity.
reviews.text: The only complaint some might have is the rooms are small, as are the decks (a couple of rooms have nice large decks) but we found it clean, comfy and cozy! Checked out the "cabana" style rooms beside the pool and wouldn't recommend them as strongly - felt like a garage in a back alley - my opinion.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall i Would take this over a large tower type hotel any day! Would love to go back!
reviews.title: Really basic room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than the EDK in the hotel I would strongly recommend the Girl and the fig restaurant across the street.
reviews.title: Privacy - great experience

reviews.text: Having dropped a ton of lettuce at Bardessono, I was delighted to pay under $200/night at El Dorado. The remodel is modern and "so-very-2010's" with its rough cut wood details, white Adler-esque pottery, clean lines and spare graphic design. We were assigned to Room 2, the north east corner with a small balcony. The corner location allowed great sunlight through shuttered windows, but the balcony overlooked the side street - not as gorgeous as the park on the other side. And during high season, I'm sure the street gets noisy. Nonetheless, there was parking in the back and yummy breakfast downstairs wafted up to wake us in the morning.
reviews.title: Nice remodel, excellent location, great deal

reviews.text: I'd say they did a decent job with redecorating the rooms - only the bad artwork above the bed bugged. And the bed! Good Lord - squeaky as all get out so honeymooners beware!
reviews.title: fun place for foodies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: great service...yummy food,,nice presentation.. it was a packed house, but did not sound too loud. we were in the quieter room in the back section..the bar area seemed more energetic. the chef is creative, the endive roasted salad was different..the salmon dish was delicious. and my husband's duck confit was likewise yummy. all in all a nice place to go ..
reviews.title: Great location and warm atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here recently during a one night get away with another couple. The location is perfect if you prefer walking to nearby restaurants and shops. The hotel is adjacent to the square and directly next to a great breakfast spot The Sunflower Cafe. Our room directly overlooked a side street which unfortunately delivered traffic and people noise until late in the night. I suggest a room on the backside of the hotel away from the street. The hotel has a great bar for after dinner drinks. The staff was friendly. The room decor was tasteful with red tile floors and decor reflective of wine country. We will stay here again.
reviews.title: Honeymoon at El Dorado

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went there for a weekend getaway after our wedding. While our room was small, the location is perfection. Parking is easy and there is so much just to walk to. The staff was wonderful, very nice. We didn't eat there for dinner but breakfast was fantastic. They even refilled our coffee, giving us to go cups prior to heading out on our way. The little details make all the difference. They didn't do anything special other than say congratulations unlike hotels I've worked in but overall, we really enjoyed.
reviews.title: Great drinks and truffle fries!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful place! Right by the plaza, which turned out to be a great benefit (evening pop-up farmers market and food stalls), wonderful laid-back small town ambiance. Terrific base to explore Sonoma wineries and come back at night to walk to excellent restaurants (including the one in the hotel) and not have to drive anywhere until tomorrow. And the best hotel breakfasts I've ever had. Excellent value, an unexpected delight. Not your high octane Yountville experience, but then we weren't looking for that- less Disneywine and more grape. Perfect.
reviews.title: Great base for exploration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at this hotel in June of 2012. I apologize for the delayed review, but better late than never?
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: The hotel is well situated on the square in Sonoma. A prime location! This is perhaps it's best asset and well worth paying a bit more. We arrived on a Thursday afternoon for an extended weekend stay, parked our rental car in the smaill parking lot (check in early to insure a spot) and didn't get in the car again until we were returning to the airport.
reviews.title: Great foo didn't stay in hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are basically similiar although some are configured a bit better than others. Noise on the square and from the restaraunt associated with the hotel can be an issue for those who retire to bed early. On the weekend we were there, activity continued until past 11PM or midnight on a couple of nights. That said, I think courtyard rooms are both more pleasant with nice views and maybe more tolerable than the street noise the other side of the hall is subject to hearing.
reviews.title: A great find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ensuite bath and room were clean with ample ammenities and good appointments. A mini bar/fridge with complimentary filtered water was a nice and ecologically friendly touch. The water is replinished each day in a glass bottle instead of the omnipresent plastic bottle. Cost effective for the El Dorado and environmentally friendly too.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel in Sonoma

description: Set on the historic downtown Sonoma Plaza, 45 minutes north of San Francisco, our boutique hotel reflects the simple charm of the wine country as well as the urban sophistication of our guests.From world class dining at our El Dorado Kitchen, to relaxing poolside, to enjoying the area’s many local activities the El Dorado Hotel is a one of a kind destination.
